intro: Tylophora dahomensis, commonly known as the Dahomey tylophora, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in forested areas and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
